title: Former Colombian President Uribe Convicted in Witness Tampering Case
snippets: The ruling, which Uribe's legal team said he will appeal, is the latest in a long-running, hugely politicised case.
The influential and controversial Uribe was found guilty in a witness tampering case and is the country’s first former president to be convicted in a criminal trial.
Mr. Uribe, a towering figure in Colombian politics, was accused of trying to bribe a former paramilitary to retract testimony damaging to him.
titles: Colombia ex-President Alvaro Uribe found guilty in landmark bribery trial
Álvaro Uribe, Colombia’s former president, found guilty in bribery trial
Alvaro Uribe, Ex-President of Colombia, Is Convicted of Bribery
summary: Former Colombian President Álvaro Uribe was found guilty in a witness tampering case, marking the first time a former president of the country has been convicted in a criminal trial. The charges stemmed from accusations that Uribe attempted to bribe a former paramilitary member to retract damaging testimony. Uribe's legal team announced plans to appeal the ruling. This case has been highly politicized and follows a long legal process.
constructiveness_reason: This story informs readers about a significant event in Colombian politics and contextualizes it by mentioning the politicization and legal process involved. title: Jewel Wasps Found to Slow Aging Through Larval "Time-Out"
snippets: Scientists have discovered that jewel wasps can slow down their biological rate of aging. Their study of jewel wasps, known for their distinctive metallic colors, has shown that they can undergo a kind of natural "time-out" as larvae before emerging into adulthood with this surprising advantage.
titles: Wasps may hold the secret to slowing down the aging process
summary: Scientists have found that jewel wasps, recognized for their metallic colors, have the ability to slow their aging process. This occurs through a natural "time-out" phase during their larval stage, allowing them to emerge into adulthood with extended longevity. This discovery highlights a unique biological adaptation in jewel wasps.
